basics.name: Ziye Chen
basics.summary: A Master's student in Artificial Intelligence at Boston University

publications.name: Large Language Models for Mathematical Analysis
publications.summary: In this research, we developed the DEMI-MathAnalysis dataset, comprising proof-based problems from mathematical analysis topics such as Sequences and Limits, Infinite Series, and Convex Functions. We also designed a guiding framework to rigorously enhance LLMs' ability to solve these problems.

projects.name: Humanity’s Last Exam
projects.summary: Contributed to a question-generation system for AI model evaluation
highlights: Developed a question-generation system for AI model evaluation
Contributed to the evaluation of AI models

projects.name: Chinese OCR through a CRNN Architecture with Attention
projects.summary: Implemented a CRNN with an attention mechanism for improved text recognition
highlights: Implemented a Convolutional Recurrent Neural Network (CRNN) architecture, enhancing the contextual understanding of text
Enhanced the model with an attention mechanism to improve focus on relevant segments of the input
Created schematics of the model structure

projects.name: Election Narratives through Prompt Engineering with GPT
projects.summary: Used GPT-based analysis on election-related emails, generating weekly insights on political parties
highlights: Used Gmail API to extract required emails from election-related accounts as data
Created charts to analyze basic information about political parties
Used prompt-based analysis for weekly merged emails

projects.name: UBC Ovarian Cancer Subtype Classification and Outlier Detection
projects.summary: Applied advanced image compression and EfficientNet for improved ovarian cancer subtype classification
highlights: Compressed images by Gem pooling (each image larger than 1GB in size)
Enhanced image compression techniques and trained an EfficientNet_b0 model to increase classification accuracy
Utilized boosting techniques, increasing accuracy from 65% to 85%

awards.title: Prize for Top-550 Question in Humanity’s Last Exam
awards.summary: Awarded $500 for accepted question(s) contributing to AI model evaluation

awards.title: Nanjing Tech University The First Prize Scholarship (2022–2023)
